poem:
The Uncertain Self  

In the fog of morning, the self  
asks questions; the owl hoots at dusk.  
Roots seek in the dark, searching for  
nourishment. We, too, hope like leaves;  
clinging to questions, praying for  
direction in breezes that never  
answer, drifting between intentions,  
half-planted, half lost, waiting for light  
to guide a misplaced seed.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I tried to not procrastinate for a week. Here’s what helped the most After 33 years, it’s time to admit: I’ve never quite got the hang of myself. Am I a morning person or a night owl? What actually motivates me? Where exactly do I work best? I often find myself thinking: “I hope I eat some vegetables today” or “I hope I reply to that email,” as though that’s up to someone else. I". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
